reviewText: The key to this movie is to understand its purpose; this was to me a tongue-in-cheek mock adventure in the style of the comic book and the Saturday morning Fun Club and I think it was carried off nicely. There are some funny lines and most of the classic stereotypes one might expect to find in a sci-fi spoof; the secret is to just have fun with it and enjoy the ride.The story line is straightforward, an alien spacecraft crashes in Italy behind German lines during WW II and is discovered by the Germans. American soldiers get trapped behind the German lines and accidentally discover the crashed alien vessel and a strange humanoid alien with an ugly face that would stop a clock. One of the funniest lines in the movie comes close to the end and involves the appearance of this alien. The special effects are deliberately dated and intended to bring back memories of old sci-fi movies and comic books. If the viewer can let go and just enjoy the story they're in for a fun time at the movies.Accepted in the right spirit it is good entertainment for the fan.
summary: A Not Too Serious Stroll Down Sci-Fi Lane

reviewText: So glad this is on DVD. Widescreen and a great print as well. This is a fun and silly action/sci-fi pick from Empire Pictures(Before they became the awful Full Moon Entertainment). Fast paced and with decent creature effects by John Carl Buechler(Ghoulies). Check it out!
